Global Forest Review

The Global Forest Update (GFU) provides annual updates on the state of the world’s forests, tracking vital trends regarding the extent of global forest resources and their condition, management, and use.

Get Started

Update:
2018
What Happened to Global Forests Last Year?

Last Year in Review: What Happened to Global Forests in 2018?
  • Tropical Forest Loss Remained High, but the Deforestation Frontiers are Shifting
  • Indonesia Experienced Lower Primary Forest Loss for the Second Year in a Row
  • Forest Loss in Brazil Remained Elevated After Fire-Related Spike
  • Other South American Forests Also Faced Increased Threats
  • Primary Forest Loss Increased in sub-Saharan Africa and Madagascar
  • 2020 Goals to Reduce or Eliminate Deforestation Will Not Be Met 15
  • 2020 Targets on Restoration are Also Likely to be Missed, but Global Data is Lacking
